intro: Tephrosia madrensis, commonly known as the Mexican tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed or open habitats. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, and it is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility. Tephrosia madrensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
